alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:53PM EST until December 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. For the Farmington River...including Simsbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Cranston...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins with numerous roads and residences affected. Evacuations may be needed along various roads in Avon and Simsbury, including Riverside Road in Simsbury. Flooding also begins to affect low lying sections of Bloomfield and East Granby. Follow the directions of emergency management officials and obey all road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:31 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:31 PM EST Monday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
